p: We obtain an exact solution for the model, in which the patient-specific response can be expressed in terms of the mechanistic model parameters [equation (SE5) in Online Supplementary Text S2]. In other words, a patient's bi-phasic BCR-ABL1 decline characterized by the slopes α, β is expressed in terms of the resulting net cytotoxic effect q= e TKI − p Y (difference between TKI toxicity and LSC proliferation) and the effects of LSC activation/deactivation p XY and p YX . Taking into account the intrinsic scaling between the mechanistic parameters ( Figure 1B), which indicates that LSC deactivation, activation, and depletion by TKI occur at different time scales, those expressions for α and β can be further simplified, allowing us to dissect the prominent processes governing each treatment phase ( Figure 1C and D, Online Supplementary Texts S5–S7 and Online Supplementary Figure S2).
